summary: The Social Security Access Act mandates the Commissioner of Social Security to provide individuals with multiple service channel options for accessing Social Security benefits and services. These options include a toll-free telephone service, an internet portal, and in-person assistance at field offices. The bill also specifies requirements for the telephone service, including language accessibility and security measures. Furthermore, it requires reports by the Comptroller General and the Commissioner on the implementation of these requirements, evaluating effectiveness, addressing barriers, and recommending improvements.
